brokers.name: CommSec
brokers.tagline: Australia's biggest broker. But is bigger better?
pros: CHESS sponsored ‚Äî you own your shares directly
cons: FX rate of 0.70% is above average
Interface feels dated compared to fintechs
No free trades or promotional offers

brokers.name: Stake
brokers.tagline: Low-cost ASX & US trading with CHESS sponsorship.
pros: $3 flat ASX trades ‚Äî among the cheapest
Free US stock trades (FX fee applies)
cons: FX rate of 0.70% on US trades
brokers.dealText: Get a free US stock when you sign up and deposit $50+

brokers.name: SelfWealth
brokers.tagline: Flat $9.50 trades with CHESS and SMSF support.
pros: Flat $9.50 per trade ‚Äî no hidden extras
cons: Interface not as polished as competitors

brokers.name: CMC Markets
brokers.tagline: First trade free each day. ASX & International.
pros: First trade FREE each day on ASX and US
cons: No SMSF support for share trading

brokers.name: IG
brokers.tagline: Global broker with deep research and CFD options.

brokers.name: Moomoo
brokers.tagline: Zero brokerage on ASX & US with powerful tools.
pros: Zero brokerage on ASX and US trades

brokers.name: Webull
brokers.tagline: Commission-free US trading with advanced tools.

brokers.name: Interactive Brokers
brokers.tagline: The pro's choice. Low fees, 150+ markets.

brokers.name: Saxo
brokers.tagline: Premium broker for high net worth investors.

brokers.name: Tiger Brokers
brokers.tagline: Low-cost US & ASX trading with social features.
cons: FX rate higher than some competitors

brokers.name: Swyftx
brokers.tagline: Australia's top crypto exchange. 300+ coins, low fees.
cons: Spread can vary in volatile markets

brokers.name: CoinSpot
brokers.tagline: Australia's longest-running crypto exchange. Simple and secure.
cons: Higher fees than Swyftx (1% instant trade)
Advanced traders may prefer lower-fee exchanges

articles.title: How to Buy Shares in Australia (2026 Guide)
articles.excerpt: The complete step-by-step guide to buying your first shares on the ASX.

sections.heading: Why Australians Are Buying Shares in Record Numbers
sections.body: More Australians hold shares today than at any point in history. The rise of low-cost online brokers has made it possible to buy your first share for as little as $0 in brokerage. But with over 10 platforms competing for your money, choosing the right one matters more than ever.

sections.heading: Step 1: Choose a Broker
sections.body: Your broker is your gateway to the ASX. The biggest decision is whether you want CHESS sponsorship (your shares are registered in your name) or a custodial model (the broker holds them for you).

sections.heading: Step 2: Open and Verify Your Account
sections.body: Most brokers require you to provide: a valid ID, your Tax File Number (TFN), a linked Australian bank account, and proof of address.

sections.heading: Step 3: Deposit Funds
sections.body: Transfer money from your bank via direct debit, BPAY, or bank transfer.

sections.heading: Step 4: Place Your First Trade
sections.body: Search for the stock by name or ASX code. Choose between a market order or a limit order.

sections.heading: Step 5: Understand the Tax Implications
sections.body: When you sell shares at a profit, you'll pay Capital Gains Tax (CGT). But if you hold for more than 12 months, you get a 50% CGT discount.

sections.heading: Common Mistakes to Avoid
sections.body: Paying too much in brokerage, ignoring FX fees, not understanding CHESS.

articles.title: Franking Credits Explained
articles.excerpt: Franking credits can add up to 30% to your dividend yield.

sections.heading: What Are Franking Credits?
sections.body: When an Australian company pays you a dividend, it may have already paid 30% corporate tax.

sections.heading: How They Boost Your Yield
sections.body: A stock with a 4% dividend yield and full franking delivers a 5.71% gross yield.

sections.heading: Who Benefits Most?
sections.body: SMSF in pension phase get the full refund. Low-income earners also benefit significantly.

sections.heading: Which ASX Stocks Are Fully Franked?
sections.body: Most big banks and miners pay fully franked dividends.

sections.heading: The Tax Trap Nobody Mentions
sections.body: If you're in the 45% bracket, franking credits help but don't eliminate your tax bill.

articles.title: CHESS vs Custodial: What You Need to Know
articles.excerpt: CHESS-sponsored brokers give you direct ownership.

sections.heading: The Ownership Question
sections.body: Two fundamentally different ways your shares can be held.

sections.heading: CHESS Sponsored: You Own Your Shares
sections.body: Registered directly in your name on the ASX subregister.

sections.heading: Custodial: The Broker Owns Them
sections.body: Shares are held in the broker's name or a nominee company.

sections.heading: So Which Should You Choose?
sections.body: For long-term investors: always choose CHESS.

articles.title: SMSF Share Trading: Rules, Brokers & Tax Traps
articles.excerpt: Running an SMSF? Here's how to trade compliantly.

sections.heading: Why SMSF Share Trading Is Different
sections.body: A Self-Managed Super Fund is a trust with legal obligations.

sections.heading: Broker Requirements for SMSF
sections.body: CHESS sponsorship, corporate trustee support, admin integration.

sections.heading: The Tax Advantage
sections.body: 15% tax in accumulation, 0% in pension phase.

sections.heading: Common SMSF Tax Traps
sections.body: In-house asset rules, sole purpose test, arm's length dealings.

sections.heading: Best SMSF Brokers Ranked
sections.body: Interactive Brokers, SelfWealth, CommSec.

articles.title: Stake Raises ASX Fees
articles.excerpt: Stake changed its fee structure. Should you switch?

sections.heading: What Changed
sections.body: Stake adjusted its ASX brokerage from the original $3 flat fee.

sections.heading: How It Compares Now
sections.body: Still cheaper than CommSec but Moomoo and CMC may be better.

sections.heading: Should You Switch?
sections.body: Use the Switching Cost Simulator to check.

articles.title: The CGT 50% Discount
articles.excerpt: Hold shares 12+ months and cut CGT by 50%.

sections.heading: The 12-Month Rule
sections.body: Hold 12 months and only 50% of the gain is taxable.

sections.heading: The Math in Action
sections.body: $5,000 profit: $1,500 before vs $750 after the discount.

sections.heading: When It Doesn't Apply
sections.body: Companies, non-residents, and share traders miss out.

sections.heading: Strategic Implications
sections.body: Buy-and-hold investors benefit enormously.

articles.title: Dollar Cost Averaging on the ASX
articles.excerpt: DCA reduces timing risk. But brokerage can kill returns.

sections.heading: What Is Dollar Cost Averaging?
sections.body: Invest a fixed amount at regular intervals.

sections.heading: Why DCA Works
sections.body: The ASX returns approximately 10% per year long-term.

sections.heading: The Brokerage Fee Problem
sections.body: $29.95 fees on $500 trades = 6% eaten.

sections.heading: Best ETFs for DCA
sections.body: VAS, IVV, VDHG.

sections.heading: Setting Up Your System
sections.body: Choose a low-fee broker, pick 1-3 ETFs, set a schedule.

articles.title: Best Brokers for International Shares
articles.excerpt: Compare FX fees for US, UK, and Asian stocks.

sections.heading: The Hidden Cost
sections.body: FX conversion fees can be 5-10x more than brokerage.

sections.heading: FX Fee Comparison
sections.body: IBKR 0.002% vs CommSec 0.70% ‚Äî huge difference.

sections.heading: Best for US Shares
sections.body: Interactive Brokers wins for serious investors.

sections.heading: W-8BEN Form
sections.body: Lodge to reduce US withholding from 30% to 15%.

sections.heading: Best All-Round
sections.body: IBKR for frequent, Stake for simple, Saxo for exotic.

articles.title: How to Read an ASX Annual Report
articles.excerpt: Annual reports are key to understanding ASX companies.

sections.heading: Why They Matter
sections.body: The single most important document for financial health.

sections.heading: 5 Sections That Matter
sections.body: Chairman's Letter, P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow, Notes.

sections.heading: Red Flags
sections.body: Declining revenue, high debt, negative cash flow.

sections.heading: Where to Find Them
sections.body: ASX announcements, investor relations websites.

articles.title: Investing for Kids in Australia
articles.excerpt: Minor's tax rate is 66%. Here's how to invest smartly.

sections.heading: The Tax Trap
sections.body: 66% tax on unearned income over $416/year.

sections.heading: Option 1: Informal Trust
sections.body: Invest in parent's name, taxed at parent's rate.

sections.heading: Option 2: Insurance Bond
sections.body: 30% internal tax, tax-free after 10 years for education.

sections.heading: Which Wins?
sections.body: Informal trust for most families.

sections.heading: Practical Steps
sections.body: Open account in your name, invest in diversified ETFs.

scenarios.title: Investing for Kids
scenarios.heroTitle: How to Invest for Your Kids in Australia (Without Getting Slugged by Tax)
scenarios.problem: Unearned income for minors is taxed at 66% over $416/year.
scenarios.solution: Informal Trust (taxed in parent's name) or Insurance Bond (30% internal, tax-free after 10 years).
considerations: Minor's tax rate: 66% on unearned income over $416/year
Informal Trust: taxed in parent's hands
Don't put investments in child's name

scenarios.title: SMSF Share Trading
scenarios.heroTitle: The Best Brokers for SMSF Share Trading in Australia (2026)
scenarios.problem: Not all brokers support SMSF accounts. You need CHESS and admin integration.
scenarios.solution: CommSec, SelfWealth, and Interactive Brokers are the top picks.

scenarios.title: Investing as an Expat
scenarios.heroTitle: How to Invest in Australian Shares as an Expat
scenarios.problem: Many brokers won't accept non-resident applications. CGT rules change.
scenarios.solution: Interactive Brokers is best for expats. Non-residents lose 50% CGT discount.
considerations: Some brokers will close your account

scenarios.title: Day Trading
scenarios.heroTitle: Best Brokers for Day Trading in Australia (2026)
scenarios.problem: Day trading requires low latency, low fees, and advanced tools.
scenarios.solution: CMC Markets and Interactive Brokers are top picks.
considerations: ATO may classify you as a share trader

config.metaDesc: Compare Australia's best share trading platforms. Honest reviews, fee calculators, and CHESS-sponsored broker comparisons. No bank bias.
config.heroSubtitle: Compare 10+ Australian share trading platforms. Real fees, real data, no bank bias. Find the broker that actually fits your situation.
